Detailed Description

The ICISMPDeviceExtension's delegate methods.

The ICISMPDeviceExtensionDelegate protocol defines the events of an ICISMPDeviceExtension object. Those methods declared within this protocol, depending on whether they are required or optional, may be implemented by any object that conforms to ICISMPDeviceExtensionDelegate.

Method Documentation

- (void) didReceiveData: (NSData *)  Data
fromICISMPDevice: (ICISMPDevice *)  Sender 
optional

Function called when the ICISMPDeviceExtension object receives some data.

This callback method is required and must be implemented by the delegate of an ICISMPDeviceExtension object, since it is the only way of retrieving the received data.

Parameters
DataNSData object containing the received data
SenderThe sender of the event.
- (void) didSendData: (NSData *)  Data
withNumberOfBytesSent: (unsigned int)  NbBytesSent
fromICISMPDevice: (ICISMPDevice *)  Sender 
optional

Function called when a ICISMPDeviceExtension object successfully sent a chunk of data.

This function is optional. It is called each time a data buffer is sent on the ICISMPDeviceExtension output stream.

Parameters
DataA NSData buffer of the data that is written on the output stream
NbBytesSentThe length of the data that is written
SenderThe sender of the event.
- (void) willReceiveData: (ICISMPDevice *)  Sender
optional

Function called when a ICISMPDeviceExtension object starts receiving some data.

This function is optional. It is called just before didReceiveDatafromICISMPDevice to inform that the sender object started receiving some data, but that the latter is not yet ready to be provided to the delegate.

Parameters
SenderThe sender of the event.
- (void) willSendData: (ICISMPDevice *)  Sender
optional

Function called when a ICISMPDeviceExtension object is about to send some data.

This function is optional. It is called after calling one of the methods used to send data or text. It informs the delegate that the data it provided to an ICISMPDeviceExtension object is about to be sent.

Parameters
SenderThe sender of the event.
